Whew, pile of productivity this weekend.

Posted by Dru Sellers on March 23, 2009

Well we are getting closer and closer to MassTransit 0.6 release.

Features to look forward to include:

  • Improved Saga support (now using Magnum StateMachine)
  • auto consumer for sagas as well
  • New outbound pipeline increases performance
  • A concept of BusServices
  • Now sitting on the Topshelf
    • topshelf to get appdomain isolated services (well its there but untested)
    • no longer using ServiceLocator.Current
    • will soon have a new command line RunAs
  • Removed the XML configuration for this release to allow the configuration DSL to flurish

Played with git, did my first branch, work, pull (to merge) and push back to origin. I really like the .gitignore file, simple concept, super helpful. I am also enjoying the branch merge stuff, need to try it out with two people on one project but think its going to be good. Also need to hook Beyond Compare up to it.

Started to build a small application ‘biblioteca‘ to see how fubumvc works. I am liking what I see, but its a bit of a pain to set up. Hopefully they will get something to help out in this area, but I am looking forward to using FubuMVC on the project now that I have it up and running.

watched Ze Frank ‘bust your cycle‘ via Tim

dinked with:

  • FluentNHibernate, i really want to bring some of that convention love to MT
  • FubuMVC, want to bring some of the policy/convention thoughts to MT
  • Ninject, watching to see where nate takes his extensibility model.

read http://bradfordcross.blogspot.com/2009/03/dsls-in-trading-domain.html yup. need to be able to evolve in production.

and I got a haircut.

-d
